alert.note: Alert for Larimer (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 15 at 8:20PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Colorado, including the following county, Larimer. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding along Buckhorn Creek near Masonville. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 817 PM MDT, A surge of water will move down Buckhorn Creek past Masonville to the confluence with the Big Thompson River this evening. Minor flooding of pastures is expected, along with possible damage to roads adjacent to or crossing the creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Masonville. - This includes the following additional locations... Moondance Way, Big Bear and Lower Buckhorn on County Road 27 above Masonville.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
